website_summaries.verdict: Best for protection from insects and mild weather. If you live in an area prone to storms, it may not work for your garden.
pros: Ideal for pest protection throughout growing season
Fleece material is lightweight and allows moisture to flow through to plants
cons: Doesn't hold up well in heavy rain and wind

customer_reviews.title: Easy for this old gardener to instal! Thank you!
customer_reviews.text: Pretty expensive so I almost gave 4 stars but I’m Old and tired. These sure beat row cloth. Happy to have something that cuts down on the work when protecting my veggies. Set up was a breeze and took seconds. I like that plants have adequate height & room to grow without touching the fabric. I also like the simple way to vent the tunnel. There are more affordable tunnels out there. I might try them, but I wonder if they would be as easy to use and well made as these? I’d like to have half a dozen more!
customer_reviews.author: KBidder

customer_reviews.title: this is perfect! strong for the rain and wind
customer_reviews.text: this is perfect! strong for the rain and wind. but soft and warm..protects my plants perfectly. I used with HARVEST-GUARD to wrap around. used clothes pin for put both together so you can open and closed any time. still growing my cherry tomato bitter melon and egg-plant.
customer_reviews.author: Yukie James

customer_reviews.title: Best thing I ever did for my Minnesota garden!
customer_reviews.text: I used these for the first time on my raised bed vegetable garden and it extended the growing season by 6 weeks through our cold fall nights in Minnesota! It was awesome eating fresh picked kale and broccoli into late November! Super easy to use and worked better than expected PLUS they are re-usable! I can't wait to see how they work in the spring for early planting
customer_reviews.author: amy

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Bought it to start out my tomatoes and squash, as the Texas sun can be super harsh and my hood is crawling with hungry wildlife. Worked great, moved up to a larger product. Am keeping this for the next planting I have planned. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: Owen L.

customer_reviews.title: This thing made my onions and lettuce grow in an ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing made my onions and lettuce grow in an Idaho "spring" which included snow, freezes, and a plethora of other crazy temperatures. In April I was harvesting full salads that tasted summer fresh. Give this thing a try, for the price, it can't be beat.
customer_reviews.author: star_slit

customer_reviews.title: Mesh is not workable for a May in Colorado frost
customer_reviews.text: There are two types. I mistakenly bought the mesh and it was not thick enough to prevent frost from getting on young plants. Solution was to use a long vinyl picnic tablecloth, the kind with fuzzy stuff underneath and put over the top and then attach with clothes pins. Worked perfect! Now the plants are too big so the tunnel was removed. It did save the tomato, pepper and cuke plants that are producing a great crop.
customer_reviews.author: F. Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, great value and a great product
customer_reviews.text: This product is extremely easy to install. You just lay it down in the right place, push the thin metal rods in to the ground and you are done. I love it. This is my second time ordering. I wish it came in other sizes to fit my raised beds better. I made the hoops a bit smaller by squeezing them to a tighter shape. That made two of these fit side by side in one raised bed. But a wider version would be great. A nice bonus; you don't have to water as often, as the plastic minimizes evaporation.
customer_reviews.author: Berit in Delaware

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed
customer_reviews.text: This micromesh tunnel is from a company known for quality products and this product is no exception. It is unbelievably well made, easy to use and easily collapses to store flat in the included packaging bag. I can imagine this will be useful for many growing seasons and I will be ordering a second one. I also really like watering through the mesh. It diffuses the water for a rain effect so that seedlings and tender plants aren't battered. But the best part? No more salad bar browsing by deer.
customer_reviews.author: Mare

customer_reviews.title: Great start and now falling apart.
customer_reviews.text: I started spring crops early and the tunnel worked fantastic. I Got the best crops for spring I ever had. I kept using it for second planting. Colorado has been hot this year. Crops are doing good but the material on the tunnel is not. It started getting holes in it. I was then placing the hoops back in the ground the material ripped. It has only been a couple months and it’s toast. Sad to see this happen. I was excited and was going to buy more.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product after using tree netting from the San company. The quality of both products is very high. I had need of this to keep ground critters too small to be stopped my my rabbit proof fencing from eating my garden. I bought two of the regular tunnels for spring and summer plants and one of the insulated tunnels for fall and early spring since we offen have both late spring and early fall frost. These will extend my growing season and will allow me to harvest more fruits and vegetables instead of competing with critters. Easy to install and maintain. Should last for several years. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Carson

customer_reviews.title: Useful
customer_reviews.text: At first I was completely impressed, but then I came to realize set-up might not be so easy, because the clothe falls off the hoops ( it can be put back ). Still, it’s a viable option for shade/critter control of young plants. Get the large if you’re unsure. I wish I had.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia K. McWilliams

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my veggies healthy
customer_reviews.text: Growing veggies in Hawaii - we get salt wind and bugs. I left my veggies alone for a month while traveling and I came back to the most beautiful garden ever. The tunnel kept the bed protected and everything looks great. Yummy bug free lettuce. We had a storm for four days but the tunnels stay put. Easy to use. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: OCW

customer_reviews.title: Great shade for rabbits
customer_reviews.text: I bought this, cut it in half (since I didn't need it to be so long) and put one half in each of my rabbits' runs to give them shade. They love it! So far, the hoops and shade cloth have survived 30 mph wind without any damage. I just ordered another one to put in my chicken run to give them shade.
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: Tunnel of my dreams
customer_reviews.text: This more than met my expectations. It's sturdy, well-designed, and easy to install and remove. We have had a cold spring in New Hampshire and my tomato seedlings are thriving under the tunnel, where they are warm, getting full sun, and are well- protected from wind. I am most impressed by the quality of materials and construction. I intend to order several more to extend my fall growing season. I think the length and height are just right to be practical and easy to handle. The tunnel looks like it will give excellent service for at least several years.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Life Changing
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. I have struggled with my garden for years. I live on a farm, and my neighbor has free range chickens that get into my starts every year. We also have extremely intense direct sunlight in my area. I put these row covers (in the micromesh) over my raised bed for my cool season veggies, and my lettuce and spinach is turning out amazing! No bugs, doesn't over heat, no animal pests! It's super easy to put up and take down for harvesting and weeding. We have LOTS of wind here, and this row cover stands up to it. Best product I've tried for crop protection in my garden!!
customer_reviews.author: Amy R.

customer_reviews.title: So handy to have!
customer_reviews.text: If you’re a garden lover, you know that the threat of frost or severe weather can really leave you panicking. These covers are so quick and easy to use! Best of all, they fold flat when you’re not using them. We had an extended period of cold heavy rain right after planting this spring, and I popped these over my rows and left them be for a few days until it was over. The plants thrived underneath and I didn’t lose a single plant!
customer_reviews.author: Imafarmer

customer_reviews.title: This past year they really escalated in price so I do not feel they are a great value, but haven't found an alternative
customer_reviews.text: These work well. We attach them to pvc pipe to give them added stability. The stakes that are attached to the tunnels would not suffice where we live due to huge wind gusts so we attach the stakes to pvc......The plastic tears in about a year and need to be replaced. This past year they really escalated in price so I do not feel they are a great value, but haven't found an alternative. I am happy with the protection that they give our plants so will re-order but will be on the look out for a better priced value......
customer_reviews.author: Linda J. Trotter

customer_reviews.title: GREAT QUALITY FABRIC
customer_reviews.text: BOUGHT MINE FROM AMAZON WAREHOUSE AND IT HAD A TEAR IN IT FROM PREVIOUS USE, HOWEVER THE OVERALL QUALITY OF THE PRODUCT WAS GOOD. HEAVY DUTY MESH, EASY TO USE, AND THE SIDES STAKE DOWN NICELY. WOULD HAVE WORKED FOR ME HAD I PURCHASED NEW, INSTEAD OF AN AMAZON WAREHOUSE RETURN. THAT WILL TEACH ME TO STOP BEING SO CHEAP.
customer_reviews.author: KachinaDesigns

customer_reviews.title: Careful! What Color Do You Need?
customer_reviews.text: I returned this because it was black and I could not use it in Central Florida. There was nothing in the ordering process to tell me to choose the color; the packaging only pictured a white item.
customer_reviews.author: htw

customer_reviews.title: Saved my plants this winter
customer_reviews.text: After accidentally killing all of my plants one winter, I really wanted to do better this year. After a whole bunch of nail biting, my plants look amazing! I really credit this fleece tunnel with protecting my plants so well that they were able to really thrive when the weather warmed up. I will admit, it can be a bit hard to maneuver the tunnel around the plants, especially when it's windy (since it's so light), but the struggle is to be expected.
customer_reviews.author: Kira

customer_reviews.title: I made a mistake with the item before, this ...
customer_reviews.text: I made a mistake with the item before, this is the one that the plants don't get any sun almost. This item was Ok. Thanks for your review of Gardman 7682 Netting Grow Tunnel, Black Polyethylene, 10' Long x 18" High , sorry for the mistake.
customer_reviews.author: Antonio Cabral

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as described - excellent product
customer_reviews.text: I ordered several of the tunnels. One of the drawstring cords were stitched to the fleece fabric. Once the damage was reported a replacement arrived the next day. Awesome service! The remaining tunnels were in perfect condition and very easy to install. They arrived after dark and my husband helped me place them in the garden as we were expecting a deep frost. The packaging for storing the tunnels is beautiful, great product, great service - will definitely reorder.
customer_reviews.author: KAREN

customer_reviews.title: Undersized, but a decent value.
customer_reviews.text: This garden cloche is actually fabric tunner that you put over seedlings to keep rabbits and birds away. And it works. Rain and sunlight go through, the ends pull tight with a cord, and the little plants are happy. But the metal brackets that support the fabric tunnel are way to light and too short to protect plants larger than seedlings. Tierra should make these in more sizes and with better quality brackets.
customer_reviews.author: DrGeorge

customer_reviews.title: I love these. I bought 4 and they are doing ...
customer_reviews.text: I love these. I bought 4 and they are doing an excellent job protecting my newly planted ferns and hostas. The tunnels are manipulable, also. They can handle right angles in your garden or other non-linear twists/bends. You can also make them a bit more narrow/wide. If you have nuisance critters in your area, buy some garden staples to secure the spaces between steel stakes to really protect your plants.
customer_reviews.author: Sakurabart

customer_reviews.title: An excellent garden tool.....
customer_reviews.text: I've tried using netting with hoops and find this tunnel much easier to use, while protecting plants from insects and other garden denizens. If you need protection for growing produce, this is the item you'll want the most.
customer_reviews.author: family buyer

customer_reviews.title: Ugly dark yellow/green color
customer_reviews.text: What I ordered was supposed to be white, but the color is a very unattractive dark yellowish green color. I am not happy with the color, and they are small. A broccoli plant will not fit under it, I think the only thing you could use it for is strawberries or lettuce. I thought they would be taller but they are barely 12 inches from the ground once the stakes are in. I'm not happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Planet West

customer_reviews.title: It's easy to put in and pull out again
customer_reviews.text: I bought the giant fleece tunnel and it's just what I needed to be able to plant a little bit earlier in the spring. It's easy to put in and pull out again, so you can move it around as you plant other, smaller veg, and you can push the cover over to one side to give them more sun during the day. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Nice hoop house for extended season veggie gardening
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight, durable material. I used it in the early spring to keep seedlings warm. I plan on using it this fall, as well. It’s large enough to protect an entire raised-bed garden row, but you might need two to cover a whole bed. I haven’t had any tears or rips, and it also does a decent job of keeping the squirrels out... or at least deterring them. I’d get more if I could.
customer_reviews.author: Kooks Dan’o

customer_reviews.title: Awesome cover
customer_reviews.text: Bought the micro mesh “giant” tunnel and it works great. It covers two rows of my plants in my garden bed. I was left with one extra link on the end and just I scrunched it to the rest. Will definitely purchase a poly tunnel next for my seedlings :)
customer_reviews.author: Daria Feder

customer_reviews.title: Good product.
customer_reviews.text: Every gardener should have these. It would be 5 stars but the sides are a little short. I am trying to keep out grasshoppers and ear wigs. A few got in but these did the job. I will take more care to put dirt on the edges to keep small bugs out. Also, provides some sun protection. Good product.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Pearce

customer_reviews.title: Generally a superior product
customer_reviews.text: I used these poly tunnels last Fall thru early Spring. They are wonderful for extending the seasons! Unfortunately one of the two tunnels i received last order had one of the hoops protruding through the poly. Just a quality control issue. I haven’t returned it yet-will wait for replacement to arrive first. These are truly a wonderful product. Accordion out with ease for plant cover and collapse for easy storage.
customer_reviews.author: Pjiaquinta

customer_reviews.title: Well made product
customer_reviews.text: It’s a nice set up. It comes with a nice case to fold it into. And it’s probably my fault I didn’t measure it out. But it’s basically good for a small row in your garden. So I’d say “Giant” is not an accurate description.
customer_reviews.author: Monica LaToush

customer_reviews.title: Great for chickens !
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used these to make a chicken tunnel so my chickens have more room to graze but be safe from the hawks. I’ve put up 4 of them so far adding garden steaks to help keep them from figuring out how to escape from under. Dundee, Cinnamon, Coq Au Vin, Token, Stripe, and Nugget thank you for making these magnificent tunnels. Works great !
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: DOUBLE the Price now...What the What?
customer_reviews.text: These tunnels worked great for winter plantings like broccoli and lettuce for the 2 years I used them. Not super durable and ended up tearing. I went to reorder and they are now DOUBLE the price....what the what?!! Will not reorder. I really just need the fabric replaced as the hoops are in good shape.
customer_reviews.author: Tntightwad

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup, good price, really products the greens!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great net tunnel—very easy to set up! It lets enough sun and rain through for my greens, but has really been keeping the bugs from decimating them the way they usually do. A Haxnicks fleece tunnel protected some crops through the winter; now I expect the net will keep others going through the summer. Great products!
customer_reviews.author: DC99

customer_reviews.title: season extension on a shoestring budget
customer_reviews.text: Here at MicroUrb Farms, this poly low tunnel is a big help during shoulder seasons and on a shoestring budget. I only wish I could just buy them nearby, so I would not have to wait for them to be delivered. Sometimes I need these at the drop of a hat.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just What I Needed
customer_reviews.text: This works exactly as described and saved my lettuce from being eaten by who knows what critter. I have a raised 2x8 foot garden and it fits over it perfectly with room to spare. It would work on something wider and longer too.
customer_reviews.author: LPF

customer_reviews.title: Get your plants in a the ground a month early
customer_reviews.text: I decided to gamble on putting some of my veggies outside in the ground in April even though our last frost is usually mothers day. I put two tomatoes outside and this lightweight tent was a miracle. Two frosts and the plants are completely fine and clearly thriving, clearly getting enough sun and moisture because I have only had to water them once in two weeks, and they are green and beautiful. (I purchased the giant fleece).
customer_reviews.author: Nina Stively

customer_reviews.title: ... frustrating to install as the cords on the ends love to get tangles in both the hoop spikes and ...
customer_reviews.text: Works well for its purpose but can be a bit frustrating to install as the cords on the ends love to get tangles in both the hoop spikes and any plants you are trying to install it over. Is durable enough to last >1 season in my hands. Not ideal for plants that you have to mess with frequently due to the need to readjust the spikes and hoops every time you need access to the plants. I will use in in plants that are sprouted but not yet in need of any other attention until they are ready to be pollinated, then again after pollination while I am awaiting fruit development. Fits perfectly into my 24" wide raised beds.
customer_reviews.author: tgull

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: I love this because the poles are flexible enough to stretch and cover the garden! I’m excited to have a winter garden this year!!! The listing I bought from said “used” but I couldn’t tell.. packaging looking like mint condition! And the fleece fabric feels as if it will be quite sturdy and last for years
customer_reviews.author: Seatonsmom

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!!
customer_reviews.text: I garden at 8,000 feet elevation in the Rocky Mountains. These covers are a game changer. They have held up to intense winds, kept my green beans alive at 28 degrees and with heavy frost, and have also kept them from drying out in the low humidity, extreme sun, and wind. I am definitely buying more.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: Second season fabric has weakened. easily torn several wholes wont last another season.
customer_reviews.text: Second season fabric has weakened. easily torn several wholes wont last another season. Over all I liked product worked well easy to use help plants. But they are only good for one or two seasons of light weather I live in zone 10 South LA
customer_reviews.author: JM Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Great for early/late planting
customer_reviews.text: We bought this as a replacement for an identical tunnel. I specifically bought the exact item because the old one worked so well and lasted for years. Easy to install/use. Works great for early/late plantings. We use it for salad greens.
customer_reviews.author: Bren

customer_reviews.title: Very useful for winter gardening
customer_reviews.text: This has protected chicories and other greens in my Pacific NW garden over the winter. Keeps them from getting too water-logged and wind-blown. It does tend to blow over in heavy winds, but is otherwise sturdy. I've been happy with the size and ease of use and set up, so I bought another to extend my winter garden plot. I plan to also use it as a mini-greenhouse in summer, maybe to shade lettuces or boost the heat for my nightshade transplants.
customer_reviews.author: Molly Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Quck, easy and durable!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use! I have lots of grasshoppers that eat tender young plants. This tunnel protected my seedlings until they were big enough to survive exposed. Light and water pass easily through while keeping pests out. The material is sturdy enough to resist tearing. I placed a stake on each end to tie the tunnel to and it stayed in place even on very windy days.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Perfect plant protector
customer_reviews.text: Very long and fits well in above ground planting bed. Water and sun go thru easily but keeps bugs and other pests out.
customer_reviews.author: Tom & Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Tore after one month of use
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to use it this season to extend my fall crops and was greatly disappointed. Not a month in use and it has torn in several areas and is useless. Great disappointment. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Baseball Mom Rules

customer_reviews.title: Only if you find how to attach it to the ground
customer_reviews.text: The quality is good but it’s very hard to attach to the ground In windy days it fly away
customer_reviews.author: Ella

customer_reviews.title: Kept my plants toasty through spring storms
customer_reviews.text: This cover is great. Easy to set up. Has kept my plants toasty through spring snow storms. It's lightweight and easy to move around the garden as needed. It's even kept the pesky neighbor dogs from trampling my garden.
customer_reviews.author: mdanseuse

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: I had to cut product in half to cover all my plants in garden bed. This definitely works. Easy install and storage. Bugs are no match for this product. Rain and sun get through the net and I have a healthy crop for eating.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love, love
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love this product!!!! My lettuce looks beautiful! Can't wait to see how the rest of my veggies take off this year.
customer_reviews.author: K. Lane

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely great product!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! So easy to use and set up was a breeze. Protected my young plants from an unseasonably cold spell. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: cherokeelilcreek1160

customer_reviews.title: Easy Tunnel is handy and durable!
customer_reviews.text: Very handy design for busy suburban gardeners. The ONLY plant cover fabric that held up over a Texas summer and in fact is still going strong!
customer_reviews.author: Fran M

customer_reviews.title: Great for an early start!!!
customer_reviews.text: Just as described. Great for starting your cold crops early. I do recommend longer stakes as windy conditions can displace tunnel. Yes, I do recommend.
customer_reviews.author: KAP

customer_reviews.title: I wish I bought these years ago.
customer_reviews.text: Love this product. Last year the rabbits made sure I had no lettuce and spinach. This year no problems with rabbits eating them. The tunnel also filters the sun so my crop do not dry up and allows rain into the cover.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer S.

customer_reviews.title: Saves aloe bed
customer_reviews.text: Way easier to deploy than a bunch of leaves and blankets. Saves my aloe in texas.
customer_reviews.author: ConsumerOfAllTheThings

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: I cannot recommend these products often enough. They have helped so much in the garden. The micromesh tunnel is great used over cabbage family plants to help keep the cabbage butterfly from laying her eggs. They may seem a bit pricey, but they last for years and what you save in your plants is worth the expense spread over the years.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine

customer_reviews.title: Protected my seedlings from near-freezing temperatures, strong winds, ...
customer_reviews.text: Protected my seedlings from near-freezing temperatures, strong winds, and harsh sun over the course of two weeks of wildly varying Georgia weather. Kept out animal visitors, too - I'm a fan.
customer_reviews.author: Rosemary C

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product for spring in Ohio.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. I used it to grow lettuce and get an early start on annual flower seeds. Worked perfectly. I plan to use it to protect late summer lettuce seedlings from hot sun.
customer_reviews.author: Bree van der Kamp

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for starting early or running late
customer_reviews.text: Would buy again to start a little earlier. Bigger than I expected and better quality than I expected too. Will make it to see another grow season.
customer_reviews.author: Jodi A.

customer_reviews.title: Worked exactly as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Product worked great. Exactly as expected. Saved my baby melon plants from sunscorch and Heat. Easy to set up and take down. I would recommend it to friends.
customer_reviews.author: BMB

customer_reviews.title: These are very easy to set up and gave my garden rows the ...
customer_reviews.text: These are very easy to set up and gave my garden rows the needed protection from the neighborhood rabbits while keeping the dog from trampling new plants. Easy to store and hang from a nail in the shed until next year!
customer_reviews.author: ryanjh02

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised and Stores easy!
customer_reviews.text: works very well. crops survived 2-3 frosts. what impressed me the most is how easy it is to store it for future use. Many times when I watered the plants or when it rained, wet slushy mud splattered all over the net. I was worried it will be time consuming task to clean it before storing it. On the day I removed the net, any dirt there was just fell off when I took it off ground. I did not have to wash it or dry it. Just taking it out of the ground shook off all the dust and dirt. I just had to fold it and hang it in the garage. How cool is that?
customer_reviews.author: Madhu Alexis

customer_reviews.title: Works to keep animals out of garden but the sun ...
customer_reviews.text: Works to keep animals out of garden but the sun didn’t get to strawberry plants well enough to produce fruit.
customer_reviews.author: rmoranty

customer_reviews.title: I'm happy I found it
customer_reviews.text: This tunnel has been a savior for my veggie garden. It gets the morning sun (East) only, but in the desert, that's enough. It has protected my veggies from drying out and suffering from the sun's rays. I'm happy I found it. I plan on getting the heavier cloth one for the winter; I'm not sure what it's made of actually, but it allows the water through, as well.
customer_reviews.author: klari2

customer_reviews.title: Very nice, easy to put up
customer_reviews.text: Very nice, easy to put up. I can water right through the mesh, or lift it up on the support rods if needed. It seems very sturdy. My squash plants were looking poor, and wilting in the day. This seems to help for some reason, maybe a bit of shade, maybe slows evaporation. The squashes in the tunnerl look better than the other bed without the tunnel. It will keep out the bugs too, until the plants get bigger.
customer_reviews.author: southern NH

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Easy Tunnel I have purchased. I really like how well these tunnels work. They are lightweight but sturdy enough to hold up well to wind and weather. I start some of my vegetables under these tunnels to protect the small plants from insects and animals.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Picking Kale in December!
customer_reviews.text: Did it's job and extended my growing season... I was still picking Kale in early December in upstate NY! Jus don't let the snow build up on it. One thing that would improve the product, is it the sides skirted out a bit. Sometimes I would find that it wouldn't quite touch the ground in areas, and I would have to hill up soil at the edges of the tunnel.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Shave

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Fast delivery and just in time for the overnight freeze warning forecast in our area. Hoping that my edible seedlings survive this confusing weather.
customer_reviews.author: Small Castle

customer_reviews.title: Worth the investment
customer_reviews.text: Well worth the investment for my cool weather crops! I would recommend for any gardener looking to care for their crops during the colder season.
customer_reviews.author: bboutique

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE this thing
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this thing!!! It works so well. With the scorching sun in southern utah and the high winds we get, this tunnel totally protects my lil' garden. I'm just about ready to harvest a buncha basil and my zucc just starting forming. So cute. The Easy Tunnel has definitely saved my first-ever garden from getting fried.
customer_reviews.author: LuvLife2Day

customer_reviews.title: Works great! Wish it were longer.
customer_reviews.text: I planted spinach under this cloche in late winter. Part of the row I planted did not fit under the protective tunnel, providing a perfect experiment to test how well it works. The seedlings protected under the cloche thrived and were several times larger and healthier than the ones left to fend for themselves in the colder air. I only wish it were longer. I'll probably buy another one for next season.
customer_reviews.author: rosencrantz

customer_reviews.title: Mini scale "high tunnel"
customer_reviews.text: Great starter for early Spring plantings, on a small scale. Good weather protection for light frosts & ground warming.
customer_reviews.author: A. Wilkins

customer_reviews.title: Hungry Critters
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my wife. She put it over her vegetable plants. And, for the first time, not one critter got to them.
customer_reviews.author: Miltspoon

customer_reviews.title: Super useful
customer_reviews.text: Needed this to cover some plants in a small backyard garden. It works great. It’s easy to remove and get to plants.
customer_reviews.author: aj

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Used this to give shade to my lettuce, spinach, and kale this past spring. Had plants growing most of the summer. This worked great to prevent the moths from laying eggs. I only wish they made a taller version because the kale was a little too tall for this unit.
customer_reviews.author: SJD

customer_reviews.title: Don't opt for the fleece
customer_reviews.text: I love the mesh version I previously got but the fleece does not hold up well. With minimal use and care the fleece has fallen apart in about 3mos of light use. Works for insulation I believe, but can't say much beyond that for durability.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine Hulteng

customer_reviews.title: Nice product ---- well made
customer_reviews.text: Nice product ---- well made. Maybe too much shade? Good idea with draw strings on the end covers. Worked well on a raised bed of lettuce this year - kept out the animals nicely while the veggies grew.
customer_reviews.author: Joe J.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install over raised beds
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install over raised beds, fleece slides easily to open the bed during warmer weather. Because the fleece is attached to the wire it doesn't move in the wind. Really nice product--hope it lasts for several years.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: So far, just what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: Last year, the starlings got my seedlings and my seeds. This is my way of keeping my plants safe. I hope they work, but they were super easy to install. I thought the mesh would be white, but yellow, white, whatever!
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing stood up to some serious wind. I have it staked into holes drilled into a 2x4 on an above ground bed. We got some SEROUS 30mph+ gust wind and this thing kept my plants safe and practically laughed at the wind!! Excellent product!!!
customer_reviews.author: Anastacio Valverde

customer_reviews.title: Handy and easy to put up
customer_reviews.text: This little fellow went up in a snap. Easy to unfurl and place the metal stakes in the soil. Impressed that it doesn't lose its grip when we have serious storms and wind. Looking forward to using it throughout our hot Arizona summer and next year during winter. Hope to have it many years, so will see how it holds up to the sun.
customer_reviews.author: AtHome

customer_reviews.title: Tiny, Tiny, Tiny
customer_reviews.text: Dimensions: 118"L x 24"W x 18"H;- this is what the description reads. I however, received a tunnel only 9 ft long. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Vicky

customer_reviews.title: Price was a bit too high.
customer_reviews.text: Two person install if your working with any type of curved line. Too pricey for what it consists of.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Gets picked up from wind easily. Had to line with bricks to hold it ...
customer_reviews.text: Gets picked up from wind easily. Had to line with bricks to hold it down. The metal bent but could easily be bent back. Gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Kate Friedl

customer_reviews.title: Effective
customer_reviews.text: Bought this item to protect plants from Las Vegas summer days. My only dislike is it is not tall enough.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Koola

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I wish these were sold locally but there not. Seems well made and good quality, its late in the season so this will not be used until next season but at least I have one to try. I would recommend for every gardener. I got it so I can keep my neighbors cat out of the garden. Nicely packaged.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: Love it though after first few rains it’s harder to keep in good shape but it’s still did a great job perfecting my crops
customer_reviews.author: dayna viola

customer_reviews.title: The large size is great!
customer_reviews.text: Nice product that's well made. The larger size is hard to find and offers a lot more crop flexibility.
customer_reviews.author: Victor J.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: came in handy when the heat was getting too hot..made a big difference
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Row cover
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. Allows me to not worry about planting some cool crops early. It keeps the birds from eating my strawberries as well. Easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: K. Pino

customer_reviews.title: No More Peter Rabbit
customer_reviews.text: Easy to unfold and to retract, the tunnel protected newly sprouted beans very well. Rabbits thwarted. Take care not to leave the tunnels to long over the maturing plants. They do reduce the light exposure, hence the sturdiness of the plants if kept too long beneath the tunnels' protections.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: Seems ideal for sun protection
customer_reviews.text: Have not used it yet, but this seems like it will work well at protecting some of my flowers from intense summer Tucson sun.
customer_reviews.author: G. Barr

customer_reviews.title: Great product. A little expensive
customer_reviews.text: These keep my tomato's from getting frost bit. Worked great and will use again next year.
customer_reviews.author: lee1402

customer_reviews.title: These worked very well to get my broccoli started for ...
customer_reviews.text: These worked very well to get my broccoli started for spring. They protected well against some of the snows we had and let in a decent amount of rain and light. I used the first one for 7-8 weeks and the second for 5; they did not appear too weathered. I anticipate getting several years’ use from them.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Caselli

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Good quality, easy to use. Have saved some of our garden seedlings and planting’s in the spring when late frosts came.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Socks

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I used them to protect my vegetable gardens from leaf burn and predators. It works great. The color also blended into the rest of the garden. The Ties help preventing the skunk and raccoon to reach the yield. The nylon net surface is really steady and seams to be able to stand for a long time. Probably will buy more for my mum's garden lately.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer yue

customer_reviews.title: Good for hoops
customer_reviews.text: This worked well - secured to hoops it doesn't fly away and keeps the rows covered in hot sun
customer_reviews.author: Dimity

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: No need to buy hoops. All in one and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: NTamazon

customer_reviews.title: Great for an extended season!
customer_reviews.text: I love this!!! I am looking forward to finding more products by this company. Comes in a bag sturdy enough to use for storage until the next season. Long enough to cover my garden bed at night, keep them warm and easy to remove for the day. Perfect for my Alaska garden!
customer_reviews.author: Kiri Abbas

product_meta.title: Tierra Garden 50-5060 Haxnicks Easy Fleece Tunnel Garden Cloche, Cover and Protect Plants from Harsh Weather, Animals, and Pests, Fleece Dome for Your Garden
product_meta.description: Size:Standard| Style:FleeceWhether extending your harvest into the fall or getting an early start for spring vegetables, the Haxnicks Giant Easy Fleece Tunnel creates warmth and insulation while allowing water and sunlight to filter through to the plant. This tunnel has multiple uses, and can be used as a mini greenhouse in the summer! Ends of tunnel have open and closable drawstring allowing variable ventilation or completely closed protection. Easy to use, easy to move and easy to store! For nearly 20 years, the Haxnicks company has been designing and manufacturing innovative garden care and plant protection products for their customers in England. Tierra Garden is proud to offer this distinctive line in the United States.
feature_bullets: WARMTH AND MOISTURE – Our Haxnicks Giant Easy Fleece Tunnel Cloche lets you extend your season into fall forget an early start on planting spring vegetables and plants! As it warms the soil, the tunnel enables earlier planting and protects against harsh weather, animals, and insects. creates warmth and insulation while allowing air, moisture, and sunlight to filter through.

EASY TO USE – With our patented, one-piece design, the Easy Tunnel Cloche is quick to set up and user-friendly.  Simply open the tunnel like an accordion and fold it neatly away after use. Getting into your garden early is a breeze!

DURABLE – Constructed from long-lasting UV-stabilized, 45gsm heavy-weight polypropylene fleece, this tunnel is strong and sturdy. The galvanized steel hoops are rust-proof and easily go into the ground to secure the tunnel in position.

ADJUSTABLE – Personalize the Easy Tunnel Cloche to meet your needs! The drawstring ends allow easy access for you to control the desired ventilation for your plants. The steel hoops let you use the entire length of the tunnel or shorten it to meet your garden's needs.

MULTIPLE DIMENSIONS – We want to make finding the perfect protector cloche for your garden easy! Our Haxnicks Easy Tunnel Cloche is available in multiple sizes and materials. Dimensions for this Easy Tunnel: 11.8"L x 18"W x 12"H
